item.description: Slides View lectures slide in your browser (html) Action Items Note that Assignment 1 is made available today. Please make sure you have sent us your gmail account at email Points of reflection Your devices contain an incredible amount of personal information. The consequences from misuse by malicious individuals for some of this information are quite easy to see (eg credit card numbers). How else can data be stolen from your machine and used in a malcious fashion?

item.title: Exploratory data analysis of breast cancer transcriptomes
item.description: Contents Slides Action Items Slides View lectures slide in your browser (html) Action Items Today’s material is the final material included in Midterm #1. Challenge Points of Reflection Many of us are familiar with representing data in spreadsheets (eg Excel of Google Sheets). Describe the fundamental differences between the two dimensional table of spreadsheets and the tibble. With respect to the discussion at the beginning of Chapter 6 in the textbook, what are some fundamental differences between an academic course environment where you are given a dataset and specific questions to complete on an assignment versus data science in research or idustrial settings?

item.title: Models of sequence evolution
item.description: Contents Slides Action Items Points of Reflection Slides View lectures slide in your browser (html) Aki’s Hidden Markov Models Action Items Assignment 4 Points of Reflection In our models, we used steps in our Markov model as a unit of time. More precisely, we “calibrated” the MMs so that they match with an expected number of mutations at the site.

item.title: Phylogenies and alignment
item.description: Contents Slides Action Items Points of Reflection Slides View lectures slide in your browser (html) Action Items Assignment 4 Points of Reflection Try to understand the long branch attraction problem. Enumerate all the undirected graphs with 6 species. Suppose you have an amino acid sequence of length 100. You apply the PAM_1 Markov model to each position. So some amino acids change, likely most don’t.
